summary: HCoV OC43, 229E, NL63 and HKU1 commonly cause upper respiratory tract infections, but can also cause severe lower respiratory tract disease. increased use of diagnostic assays has facilitated detection and voluntary reporting of HCoV to the national Respiratory and Enteric Virus Surveillance System (NREVSS) 1,589 (7.7%) tested positive for any HCoV; 50% of HCoV-positive individuals were male. median age was 22 (range 0–96) years.
